comments.body: If you can solve this, then maybe stay silent or you will be executed in a day as everything in cybersecurity relies on P â‰  NP.Â  No amount of money can buy us this answer.Â  We hopefully do not deserve it.

comments.author: tromp
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on October 18, 2023, 06:55:22 PMI know the article is for 2014, but I just found out what NP really means, but have a question:Is solving DLP considered to be one of the 7 millennium problems in mathematics? No; the Discrete Logarithm Problem is not one of them.The closest problem on the list is P vs NP.P = NP implies that DLP is easy, but the reverse implication need not hold.
